"Process Stage" widget
The "Process Stage" widget displays the full name and contact details of the performer of the business process stage
(most often the examination stage) of the current route object.
Example of a configured widget:
Before starting the widget configuration, create a new
object type
and then its instances.
The "Process Stage" widget can be configured in the editing mode of the
visual
. To do this, find the widget in the corresponding list in the "Elements" window and drag-and-drop it to the workspace.
Widget settings
Configuring the widget involves filling in the following settings:
Setting
Purpose
Stage name
Entering the name of the business process stage.
Responsible employee identification algorithm (returns employee ID)
Selecting an algorithm that determines the ID of the employee responsible for the route object
Chat employee list algorithm
Selecting an algorithm that determines the list of employees of the general chat via the
dict
function.
Collapse/expand widget algorithm (returns true/false)
Selecting an algorithm that determines the state of the widget when opening the instance profile. Possible options:
true - widget is expanded;
false - widget is collapsed.
Examination attribute
Selecting an object attribute with the examination result.
Color detection algorithm (returns color as a string)
Selecting an algorithm that determines the color of the element to the right of the stage name. The color specified in the algorithm should be in HTML format.
Employee role algorithm
Selecting an algorithm that determines the role (position) of the assigned employee.
Hide due diligence time
A feature that allows users display information about the start and end dates of a business process stage and about the actual and regulatory time of completion of the stage.
Start date algorithm (returns the Date)
Selecting an algorithm that determines the date of acceptance of the task (stage of the business process). The parameter is available when the "Hide due diligence time" option.
End date algorithm (returns the Date)
Selecting an algorithm that determines the completion date of the task (stage of the business process). The parameter is available when the "Hide due diligence time" option is active.
Actual date algorithm (returns seconds)
Selecting an algorithm that determines an actual period of the task completion (stage of the business process). The parameter is available when the "Hide due diligence time" option is active.
Normative date algorithm (returns seconds)
Selecting an algorithm that determines a normative period of the task completion (stage of the business process). The parameter is available when the "Hide due diligence time" option is active.
Employee name attribute
Selecting an attribute of the "Employee Directory" type with information about the name of the responsible employee. The parameter is available after adding the algorithm for determining the responsible employee.
Employee subdivision attribute
Selecting an attribute of the "Employee Directory" type with information about the name of the responsible employee. The parameter is available after adding the algorithm for determining the responsible employee.
Employee phone attribute
Selecting an attribute of the "Employee Directory" type with information about the phone number of the responsible employee. The parameter is available after adding the algorithm for determining the responsible employee.
Employee email attribute
Selecting an attribute of the "Employee Directory" type with information about the email of the responsible employee. The parameter is available after adding the algorithm for determining the responsible employee.
== Configuration example
The widget can be configured as follows:
The
getWorkDatesBetween
function – which calculates the number of seconds in the period – is used to configure the actual and normative periods. Specify an instance of the
"Calendar" object type
in the function parameters, that defines working days and holidays.
After saving the settings, the System will display the widget in the instance profile.
Clicking
opens a chat with employees specified in the widget.
Clicking
opens a modal window with employees defined by the algorithm along with System administrators. After selecting the necessary employees, click the "Open" button which opens the chat with the selected employees.
